intro: Schmaltzia kearneyi, commonly known as the Kearney's schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has slender, trailing stems. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
